text: The 2005 Atlantic Sun Conference Baseball Tournament was held at Melching Field at Conrad Park on the campus of Stetson University in DeLand, Florida from May 26 through 28. won its fifth tournament championship to earn the Atlantic Sun Conference's automatic bid to the 2005 NCAA Division I Baseball Tournament. ==Seeding== The top six teams (based on conference results) from the conference earn invites to the tournament. {|class=wikitable ! Team |- |rowspan=3| P || Mickey Storey || Florida Atlantic |- | Robbie Elsemiller || Stetson |- | Chris Salberg || Florida Atlantic |- | C || Drew Butera || UCF |- | rowspan=3| IF || Brian Bocock || Stetson |- | Blake Lalli || Gardner–Webb |- | Matt Ray || UCF |- | rowspan=3| OF || Jon Shapland || Florida Atlantic |- | John DeStefano || Stetson |- | Shane Jordan || Stetson |- | DH || John Still || Stetson |} ===Tournament Most Valuable Player=== Shane Jordan was named Tournament Most Valuable Player. Jordan was an outfielder for Stetson. ==References== Tournament Category:Atlantic Sun Conference Baseball Tournament Atlantic Sun Baseball Tournament
title: 2005 Atlantic Sun Conference Baseball Tournament
